conclusion: Analyze changes in pressure and volume during isothermal process C→D.
Process C→D is isothermal, meaning temperature remains constant.
For an isothermal process, the product of pressure (P) and volume (V) is constant (Boyle's Law).
If volume decreases from V_C to V_D, pressure must increase from P_C to P_D to maintain constant product.
Pressure is proportional to the number of molecules colliding with the wall per unit time.
Increase in pressure indicates an increase in molecular collisions per unit area per unit time.
As volume decreases from V_C to V_D, pressure increases from P_C to P_D.
Number of molecules colliding with the unit area of the wall per unit time increases from state C to state D.
